thread.title: Israeli Strike Near Damascus: Latest Updates and Impact on Israel-Hamas Conflict
thread.title_full: Israeli Strike Near Damascus: Latest Updates and Impact on Israel-Hamas Conflict

author: archyde
title: Israeli Strike Near Damascus: Latest Updates and Impact on Israel-Hamas Conflict
text:
2023-12-28 21:58:00
An Israeli strike targeted the area around Damascus, the Syrian capital, on Thursday, the Syrian Defense Ministry and state media announced, in a context marked by the conflict between Israel and Hamas.
“At approximately 23:05 (20:05 GMT) today, the Israeli enemy carried out airstrikes from the occupied Syrian Golan, targeting targets in the southern region,” the Defense Ministry said in a statement. communicated, without mentioning any victims.
“Our air defense intercepts hostile targets in the vicinity of Damascus,” the official Syrian agency SANA wrote earlier. “An Israeli attack targeted the surroundings of the capital Damascus,” state television added.
Israel rarely comments on strikes targeting Syria but has repeatedly said it will not allow its archenemy Iran, which supports President Bashar al-Assad’s government, to expand its presence there.
Israel-Hamas war: new death toll of 21,320 for Palestinian victims
According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, the strikes targeted a Syrian air defense position in the Sweida region, to the south, and the surroundings of Damascus international airport.
The attack near the airport came 24 hours after the resumption of flights, suspended since an Israeli attack at the end of November just hours after it reopened following similar attacks the previous month, said the London-based NGO , which has a large network of correspondents in Syria.
Israel has launched hundreds of airstrikes on its northern neighbor since Syria’s civil war began in 2011, mainly targeting Iranian-backed forces, including Lebanese Ayatollah fighters, as well as army positions. Syrian.
But it has intensified its attacks since the start of the war between Israel and Hamas on October 7, as tensions rise in the Middle East.
